Description: Section (two fragments joined) of the body of a grey-brown pottery jar, the fabric is grey in section and contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of two columns of black-painted hieratic text, containing three and six lines respectively, giving an account of cuts of meat (presumably the contents of the jar).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
